definition: to take care of/to sort out/to manage/to put in order
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: But everyone can tell cheap or poorly cared-for shoes.
sentences.chinese: 但是每个人都能看出廉价或者不常打理的鞋子来。

sentences.english: She's also e-mailing me daily to-do lists.
sentences.chinese: 她还把每日需打理事务的清单电邮给我。

sentences.english: XiaoMin cannot go back to the home for my parents with small-business hua.
sentences.chinese: 小敏无法回到了老家华欣帮父母打理小本生意。

sentences.english: To help you on your way to becoming an early riser try getting things ready the night before.
sentences.chinese: 在前天晚上就把事情打理好有助你成为早起者。

sentences.english: For yardwork, hire a teenager to do it for a month.
sentences.chinese: 至于庭院打理，这个月请一个年轻人来做。

sentences.english: Upon use, hair is softer, shinier and more manageable.
sentences.chinese: 使用后头发变得柔软，闪亮易于打理。

sentences.english: The Qin Dynasty isn't dealing with that hero, merely turns a head to ask Tang Ao.
sentences.chinese: 秦朝不在打理那个杨杰，而是转头问着唐傲。

sentences.english: when you're getting ready to hit your pick-up spots, definitely take a shower but DON'T SHAMPOO YOUR HAIR.
sentences.chinese: 当你准备要打理，绝对要洗澡，但不要洗头发。

sentences.english: Its hard to imagine a time when people weren t concerned with taking care of their appearance and their bodies.
sentences.chinese: 很难想象一个人们不在乎打理外表和身体清洁的时代。

sentences.english: Organize your living space and working space.
sentences.chinese: 打理你的生活空间和工作空间。

sentences.english: Have you ever worked with Asian hair?
sentences.chinese: 你打理过亚洲人的头发吗？

sentences.english: Jim gardened at the homes of friends on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆周末帮忙打理朋友家的花园。

sentences.english: Self-restraint and a little good grooming is.
sentences.chinese: 自我克制和打理一下精神面貌才是。

sentences.english: Uh, Also, But now I really do not have energy to take care of things that.
sentences.chinese: 呵，想想也是，可我现在真的没有精力打理那些东西。

sentences.english: Goi dropped out of high school to help his father at the store.
sentences.chinese: 魏成辉在念高中时辍学，帮助父亲打理店铺。

sentences.english: Old gramps will even act as your assistant.
sentences.chinese: 老爷爷将会作为你的助手打理农场。

definition: everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
to look after/to attend to/to have in care
to clean/to sweep
to manage/to handle
to tend/to take care of sb
to prune/to trim
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to look after/to tend (one's crops, garden, livestock, pets etc)/to repair
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to worry about
to look after/to provide for
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to do sth oneself
various jobs/low-grade work
household duties/housework
